title: ‘Bye Bridget’: Somerville bakery claps back at internet ‘troll’ with a line of merch
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Somerville's Hearth & Hug Bakery faced criticism for donating sales to a Minnesota food bank during anti-ICE protests.
Responding to online trolling, owner Natalie Hug launched 'Bye Bridget' merchandise, donating proceeds to various charities.
The bakery continues to support multiple causes, including organizations aiding immigrants, LGBTQ+ youth, and homelessness.

title: ‘Keep their light on in our world’: Daughter remembers Eastham couple who fell through ice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Jerry and Kathleen Boucher died after falling through ice at Bee’s River in Eastham on February 14.
The couple, active in their community, were known for charitable acts including aiding Cape Cod and Hartford residents.
Daughter Katy Boucher urged the public to honor her parents by helping others, reflecting their community spirit.

title: 3 fires being investigated as arson in Fitchburg, officials say
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Three recent fires in Fitchburg are being investigated as arson, according to State Fire Marshal Jon Davine.
Two fires occurred on Feb. 14 and 15 at an apartment building on Blossom and Day streets in Fitchburg.
A third fire on Feb. 18 at Myrtle Avenue displaced seven people; officials do not believe it's related to the others.

title: Eric Dane, ‘Grey’s Anatomy’ star and ALS awareness advocate, dies at 53
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Eric Dane, known for 'Grey's Anatomy' and 'Euphoria,' died from ALS at 53, less than a year after diagnosis.
Dane was an advocate for ALS awareness and received the ALS Network's advocate of the year award in September 2025.
Survived by wife Rebecca Gayheart and daughters Billie and Georgia, Dane's memoir 'Book of Days' is set for 2026 release.

title: 4 Mass. State Police troopers charged in death of recruit suspended with pay
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Four Massachusetts State Police troopers charged in Enrique Delgado-Garcia's death are suspended with pay.
Troopers are charged with involuntary manslaughter and causing bodily injury during a training exercise.
Lt. Jennifer Penton also faces a perjury charge for allegedly lying about Delgado-Garcia's symptoms.

title: Braintree police warn public about planned ‘takeover’ at South Shore Plaza
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Braintree police are alerting the public to a planned 'takeover' at South Shore Plaza, scheduled for Friday evening.
The takeover, advertised on social media for 7 p.m., could attract large crowds, prompting police to develop an operational plan.
Past similar events in Massachusetts involved street blockades, car burnouts, and violence, leading to increased law enforcement vigilance.

title: Kendrick Perkins has Celtics as ‘dark horse’ to win title in 2026 — under 1 condition
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kendrick Perkins views the Boston Celtics as a 'dark horse' to win the 2026 title if Jayson Tatum returns.
Despite Jayson Tatum's absence due to an Achilles injury, the Celtics are second in the Eastern Conference at 35-19.
Perkins highlights Jaylen Brown's MVP-caliber performance and the team's strong culture as reasons for their potential success.

title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: ESPN analyst Seth Walder proposed the Patriots trade a 2026 first, third, and sixth-round pick for AJ Brown.
AJ Brown, 28, is coming off a fourth consecutive 1,000-yard season and under contract with the Eagles until 2029.
The trade would add Brown to the Patriots, who reached the Super Bowl despite a receiver group lacking depth.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Kyle Pitts caught 88 passes for 928 yards and 5 TDs with Atlanta in 2025, earning Second Team All-Pro honors.
Patriots seek offensive upgrades after losing the Super Bowl, considering Pitts as a top target for enhancing their roster.
Pitts could be a cost-effective acquisition at $17.5 million annually, compared to high-priced wide receivers like Alec Pierce.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, of Provincetown, pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
Law enforcement investigations revealed Pagnoni distributed thousands of child pornography files using the MEGA platform.
Pagnoni faces up to 20 years in prison, supervised release, and a $250,000 fine for each charge.
